Dispute_Type: Eligibility as a family class member based on adoption
Legal_Issue: Whether Kuldip Kaur's adoption meets the definition of 'adopted' under Canadian Immigration Regulations
Procedural_Context: Judicial review of Appeal Division's decision
Credibility_Assessment: Conflicting testimonies, lack of genuine intent
Basis_of_Claim: Adoption creating a genuine parent-child relationship
Evaluation_Standard: Authenticity of adoption not for immigration purposes
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Adoption at age 12, delayed sponsorship, no genuine transfer from birth family
Legal_Standard: Adoption must create genuine parent-child relationship, not for immigration advantage
Application_Factor: Age at adoption, timing of sponsorship, familial integration
Decision_Outcome: Kuldip Kaur not considered a family class member
Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of Appeal Division’s finding on authenticity of adoption
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by judicial review)
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Definition of 'adopted' under Canadian Immigration Regulations
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of genuine parent-child relationship; adoption not authentic for immigration purposes
Evidentiary_Issues: Conflicting testimonies, lack of documentary support for genuine relationship
Credibility_Issues: Conflicting testimonies regarding intent and relationship
Relevant_Law: Canadian Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
